intro: Drimia calcarata, commonly known as the rock lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive spurred shape. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Drimia calcarata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Asparagaceae family.
